Detailed Description

template<typename T, typename Alloc = std::allocator<T>>
class thrust::host_vector< T, Alloc >

A host_vector is a Host Sequence that supports random access to elements, constant time removal of elements at the end, and linear time insertion and removal of elements at the beginning or in the middle. The number of elements in a host_vector may vary dynamically; memory management is automatic. The memory associated with a host_vector resides in the memory space of the host associated with a parallel device.

Please refer to the C++ STL for the documentation of host_vector's API.

See also:
http://www.sgi.com/tech/stl/Vector.html

device_vector

Bug:
The following members do not exist yet: reverse_iterator, const_reverse_iterator, rbegin, rend, pop_back, insert, operator<.
